artist: Artist: Natori Shunsen; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
description: portrait of a male actor wearing a blue and white head wrap and a blue, red, white and black costume with gloves; grey ground
inscription: 昭和廿九年一月作 {Shōwa nijūkyūnen ichigatsu saku} (made in January 1954)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
portfolio: From New Version of Figures on the Stage (Shinpan butai no sugata-e 新版舞台之姿絵)
signed: 梶蔦齋春仙畫 {Bichōsai Shunsen ga} (picture by Bichōsai Shunsen)
text: Twenty-first design of a set of thirty. Imagined portrait of the actor Ichikawa Sadanji III (1898-1969) as Azuma no Yoshirō in the kabuki play "A Harlot's Love in a Returning Palanquin" (Modori kago iro ni aikata 戻駕色相肩). Yoshirō is a palanquin bearer who, like his companion Jirosaku, becomes interested in the young woman they carry. The two bearers begin to brawl about their amorous adventures which results in a real fight once they revealed that they are actually sworn enemies who travelled in disguise.
title: Actor Ichikawa Sadanji III as Yoshirō in the play "Modori kago"
